newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's ICA to pay 620 mln pesos for warehouses.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's ICA to pay 620 mln pesos for warehouses.

text.p: Mexican construction giant Empresas ICA will pay 620 million pesos for warehousing company Almacenadora del Sur (Alsur), a high-level company director said Thursday.
ICA won the public auction for Alsur in April, bidding higher than corn flour miller Minsa. The amounts bid were never divulged.

"We offered 620 million pesos. We have not paid it yet; we are seeing what scheme is worked out for the payment, whether it is cash, credit or a combination of both," the ICA director said in a telephone interview.

Alsur is one of three warehousing packages being privatized this year. It used to form part of the state-owned storage firm Almacenes Nacionales de Deposito SA (ANDSA). Auctions for the other two units based in the north and west of the country are still to take place.

Alsur is primarily focused around Mexico's largest port Veracruz (whose container terminal was concessioned to ICA in July 1995) and also includes a silo complex in the State of Mexico, close to the capital city.
